title: Tanju Gürsu
text:
Tanju Gürsu (30 October 1939 – 7 June 2016) was a Turkish actor, director and screenwriter, who was a major star of Turkish cinema in the 1960s and 1970s. He appeared in films such as "<a href="Haremde%20D%C3%B6rt%20Kad%C4%B1n">Haremde Dört Kadın</a>" (1965) and "<a href="%C3%9C%C3%A7%20Korkusuz%20Arkada%C5%9F">Üç Korkusuz Arkadaş</a>" (1966) under director <a href="Halit%20Refi%C4%9F">Halit Refiğ</a>. As director he directed films such as "<a href="Erkek%20Kaz%C4%B1m">Erkek Kazım</a>" (1975) and "<a href="Kaz%C4%B1m%27a%20Bak%20Kaz%C4%B1m%27a">Kazım'a Bak Kazım'a</a>" (1975).
He died of respiratory failure on 7 June 2016 at the age of 77.
